intro: Dryandra sessilis var. flabellifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with a compact and upright growth habit. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
